item.title: All VALORANT Champions Winners – Full List of VALORANT World Champions
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/all-valorant-champions-winners/

Every year, the best VALORANT team at the world is crowned at VALORANT Champions, which serves as the world championship for Riot Games’ agent-filled tactical shooter. Over time, the event has drawn larger audiences as the game expands its global reach, and that reach is exemplified in all the different regions that have claimed the trophy at VALORANT Champions.

VALORANT may have a shorter history than several other esports titles, but that just makes the hall of Champions winners that much more exclusive.

All VALORANT Champions Winners, In Order

There have been four VALORANT Champions winners so far, beginning with the inaugural tournament in 2021.

Acend – 2021

Acend’s story has somewhat of a sad ending, as the organization didn’t acquire partnership in the VCT international leagues, and was forced to close its doors in 2024 due to unsustainability. But the organization and its players still hold the distinction of being the first ever VALORANT Champions winners, defeating a Gambit team that had dominated the scene for virtually the entire year in a thrilling five-map series in the grand finals.

  • Santeri “BONECOLD” Sassi
  • Mehmet “cNed” İpek
  • Vladyslav “Kiles” Shvets
  • Patryk “starxo” Kopczyński
  • Aleksander “zeek” Zygmunt
  • Laurynas “Nbs” Kisielius (coach)

LOUD – 2022

Brazilian organization LOUD entered VALORANT at the start of 2022, and finished the year with a world championship. LOUD pulled the best talent from Brazil together under one electric green banner, and found a rival wearing green themselves in OpTic Gaming. The two teams faced each other six times during the 2022 season, but LOUD got the last laugh in the upper bracket final and the grand final of Champions 2023.

  • Bryan “pANcada” Luna
  • Gustavo “Sacy” Rossi
  • Matias “Saadhak” Delipetro
  • Erick “aspas” Santos
  • Felipe “Less” Basso
  • Matheus “bzkA” Tarasconi (coach)

Evil Geniuses – 2023

Evil Geniuses’ championship run in 2023 is considered one of the miraculous runs in the history of esports. Coach Christine “potter” Chi started with a roster of lowly regarded players and added a completely unknown player from an open tryout mid-season. The North American team stunned the international audience with a grand finals run at Masters Tokyo, then knocked off Champions contenders like DRX, LOUD, and finally Paper Rex to win the world championship in front of a Los Angeles home crowd.

  • Kelden “Boostio” Pupello
  • Ethan “Ethan” Arnold
  • Alexander “jawgemo” Mor
  • Corbin “C0M” Lee
  • Max “Demon1” Mazanov
  • Christine “potter” Chi (coach)

EDward Gaming – 2024

Riot Games’ expansion of the international VALORANT esports ecosystem into China couldn’t have gone any better for the region. EDward Gaming, after dominating the Chinese scene again but falling short on the international stage, finally had their moment at Champions 2024. In Seoul, EDG went undefeated in playoffs, defeating Team Heretics in an amazing grand final, cementing Zheng “ZmjjKK” Yongkang as the top star of Chinese VALORANT.

  • Wan “CHICHOO” Shunzhi
  • Wang “nobody” Senxu
  • Zheng “ZmjjKK” Yongkang
  • Zhang “Smoggy” Zhao
  • Hsieh “S1Mon” Meng-hsun
  • Tang “Muggle” Shijun (coach)

Across these four years of VALORANT, no team has accomplished the feat of winning both a Masters event and Champions. Only one player has accomplished this: Sacy, who won Champions 2022 with LOUD and Masters Madrid 2024 with Sentinels.

Who do you think will lift the Champions trophy in 2025? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

Stay tuned to Insider Gaming for the latest esports news. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Destiny 2 is Receiving Star Wars Skins Along with Heresy Act 1
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/destiny-2-star-wars-collab-heresy-act-1/

Bungie announced today that Destiny 2 will receive Star Wars skins and cosmetics on February 4, 2025, along with the game’s third and final Episode, Heresy. 

The developers have only teased the upcoming Destiny 2 Star Wars skins and cosmetics, and we have yet to learn what exactly will be released. Players should expect new armour ornaments, accessories, emotes, and finishers inspired by Star Wars. Additionally, at the launch of Heresy, three new armour ornaments (one per Guardian class) will become available. And the inspiration for these ornaments will be “the soldiers of the Galactic Empire”. 

Destiny 2’s Heresy Act 1

Apart from the Destiny 2 x Star Wars collaboration, the developers have released details about their third episode and final epilogue, Heresy. Guardians should expect the return of a familiar foe: the Dreadnaught. However, this time, the players will take the fight to the Dreadnaught through a new exploration and combat-based activity: The Nether. The Heresy Episode will consist of three Acts.

Moreover, the developers will experiment with player modifiers in the upcoming Destiny 2 update. Once the Heresy update arrives, players will observe new modifiers “with increased health pools, no regenerating of health, low ammo drops and revive tokens, and a modification on healing in the sandbox over the course of play.” Bungie wants players to strategically build their loadouts for survivability as health pools increase and regen is stopped in the upcoming update. 

In other news, according to claims, Bungie’s upcoming MOBA is inspired by Smash Bros. The development studio allegedly hired fans because they would “work for less.” What are your thoughts on Destiny 2’s Star Wars collaboration? Let us know in the comments below or on our community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about the newest victim to layoffs, Fast Travel Games, and don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Prepare for Fasnacht Day! Here’s Where to Find Helvetia in Fallout 76
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/where-to-find-helvetia-in-fallout-76/

In the aftermath of the bombs dropping in and around Appalachia, much of the wasteland is barren and rife with danger. But some settlements and tows prove relatively sane and peaceful. Helvetia is neither. It’s a strange haven. But it’s where you’ll find the annual Fasnacht Event! Here is where to find Helvetia in Fallout 76!

How to Find Helvetia in Fallout 76

You can find Helvetia in Fallout 76 by venturing into The Forest region, an early-game portion of the world map, and then head south of Morgantown, along the river, and just east of Sutton. It’s a small town with a main road, a three-way intersection, and a handful of buildings, including a church and several residential abodes.

Overall, the area is relatively quiet for the post-apocalypse. It’s home to a handful of Scorched on any given day, except during Fasnacht when all hell breaks loose, and people flock to the town in droves to celebrate in strange masks and with music aplenty!

Quests in Helvetia

You won’t find typical quests in Helvetia, though you will partake in various events, such as Fasnacht Day. It’s an annual event that brings players together to help the Protectrons of Helvetia celebrate the iconic albeit strange holiday commonly found in West Virginia. It’s characterized by strange masks, cheerful music, and plenty of brews to wash down the radiation.

Creatures in Helvetia

On an average day, Helvetia is quiet. It’s home to a handful of Scorched, none of which pose much of a threat to a terrifying Vault Dweller such as yourself, right? But during Fasnacht, the town starts to experience the hustle and bustle of the wasteland. During the annual event, you’ll stumble upon:

  • Bee Swarms
  • Honey Beast
  • Megasloth
  • Rabbit
  • Radtoad
  • Squirrel
  • Super Mutant
  • Super Mutant Suicider
  • Wolf

Plus, there’s always the occasional Protectron to assist!

What’s your favorite part of Fasnacht Day in Fallout 76? Let us know in the comments, or visit the Insider Gaming community forum to share screenshots of the event!

Do you know what makes finding points of interest like Helvetia easier? Scoring a jet pack in Fallout 76 will let you zoom across the map and soar through the skies!

item.title: Cities: VR Developer Fast Travel Games Hit With Layoffs
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/cities-vr-developer-fast-travel-games-hit-with-layoffs/

Another virtual reality (VR) studio has been bitten by the layoff bug. Fast Travel Games, the developers behind titles such as Cities: VR and Into The Radius, announced on Tuesday that it is laying off 30 people because of low game sales.

The announcement was made via a statement on social media.

“Due to lower sales than expected from our six game launches in 2024, in combination with a more uncertain year ahead for VR Games as a whole, we’ve taken the difficult decision to make 30 employees redundant at FTG,” Fast Travel Games’ statement reads. “These changes will affect mainly our Publishing, Marketing, and Admin departments, although the Studio will also be impacted as we consolidate down to one development team.”

They continued: “This is an exceptionally difficult decision, but we believe it’s necessary to ensure a stable and sustainable future for the company.

“Our focus now is on supporting all Fast Travellers through this challenging time. We’re grateful for the invaluable contributions of those leaving and remain committed to continue launching incredible games for our players.”

With the layoffs at Fast Travel Games, January has seen 21 studios either hold layoffs or shut down. The total estimated jobs lost as of writing sits around 700. The only bright spot at the moment is that, at this time last year, the games industry had already seen nearly 6,000 lose their jobs.

What do you think of the latest layoffs to hit the gaming industry, and the current state of VR games? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what studio is working with The Coalition on Gears of War: E-Day, and the latest studio to hold layoffs and possibly close. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: Medieval Dynasty Update 2.3 Lets Us Customize Our Towns
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/medieval-dynasty-update-2-3-lets-us-customize-our-towns/

On the surface, Medieval Dynasty looks like the type of pump-and-dump indie game that studios toss out to earn a quick buck before moving on to the next project. But that’s utterly incorrect in this case, as developer Render Cube continues to impress with content update after update. The most recent release, Medieval Dynasty update 2.3, allows us to paint buildings, construct house presets, stack items, and so much more!

What’s New in Medieval Dynasty Update 2.3?

Right, so the house presets, economy tab, and item stacking are excellent additions that will make life in Medieval Dynasty ten times easier. But let’s be honest, we’re all here for the ability to paint our structures. We can have a brightly-colored town, ready to catch a trader’s eye or perhaps a wolf. It’s likely the latter.

  • Painting
  • House Presets
  • Economy Summary Tab
  • Item Stacking
  • Full Focus Skill

Full Patch Notes for Update 2.3.0.0

Added

  • Remote Storages – A player can use resources from remote storages when crafting/building while within their range. The maximum range increases with the level of the storage. This also works for a chest in the building where the player is crafting.
  • Economy summary tab – contains data from different time periods on items created and consumed in the village
  • Painting the walls of buildings with colours and patterns
  • House presets with sticks / logs / stones
  • Item stacks with different conditions
  • Option to take all items from containers and bandit corpses
  • Memorial Stone on the Oxbow map
  • New hit and swipe sounds for battle axe
  • Sounds of hitting snow, fabric, armour with: iron axe, stone axe, fists, iron hammer
  • New footsteps sounds for NPCs and players – metal armour
  • Season switch sounds (different sounds for each season)
  • Projectiles spawning particles when breaking

Fixed

  • Husbandry animals leaving their pens
  • The map opening with the player marker in the centre
  • Centering on a player on a map
  • Inability to turn in side quests to Derwan during main story while on a horse
  • Broken vase given as a quest reward
  • Wrong bucket counting for event restrictions
  • Fixed reward for quest Flowertelling
  • Fixed weight of simple torch
  • Events not taking storages into account
  • Some events
  • Head shape of a player resetting after loading the game
  • Character’s ears sticking closely to the head even if the helmet’s visibility is turned off
  • Wrong character hair variant if a barber was visited while wearing a helmet with turned off visibility
  • Melee weapons not having any reverb inside buildings and caves
  • Range weapons getting stuck preventing bandits from shooting

Updated

  • Player can hide unavailable items in People’s Demand Control tab in Management
  • Buildings costs are now visible in crafting menu
  • Item prices now take into account their condition
  • The total animal feed demand is now visible in the building details
  • Number of dye slots is now visible in the item description
  • Less poison reduction: Cherry Wine
  • Higher productivity: Bucket with Milk
  • Changed technology gain from crafting most items
  • Changed experience gain from crafting most items
  • Changed availability from Vendors: Knives, Sickles, Scythes, Scissors, Shovels, Hand Lantern, Pouches, Backpacks, Saddlebags, Spears, Bows, Crossbows
  • Reduced temperature of the hottest summer weather
  • Women with infants go for a walk outside their house
  • Building walls colorations for story villages
  • Mixed special audio effects: stagger and block break
  • New sounds of sword hitting snow
  • Slight network optimizations for Fields and Orchards
  • Reduced memory usage when a great number of NPCs is present
  • Tweaked projectile hit effects
  • All Languages updated
  • Skill Handyman has been removed. From now on, everyone can insulate their homes.
  • Instead of the Handyman skill, there will be a Full Focus skill which removes stamina consumption from Inspector Mode

We’d love to hear about your recent town in Medieval Dynasty down in the comments! Or, visit the Insider Gaming community forum to share screenshots!

Speaking of history, recent reports indicate the next God of War focuses on Egyptian mythology! What a win!

How To Find Clues For The Superweapon in Sonderzüge Sabotage in Sniper Elite Resistance

Finding the Superweapon Clues in Sniper Elite Resistance’s Sonderzüge Sabotage level is tough, but we’ve managed to snipe the answers.

How To Find Pink Floyd Fight in Mortal Kombat 1

Mortal Kombat 1’s Floyd character and fight took a long time to uncover, but it’s done, and we can show you how to trigger it.

All Mission 2 Dead Drop Workbenches in Sniper Elite Resistance

Dead Drops is the second level to feature in Sniper Elite Resistance, and the Mission 2 Workbenches are sneakily strewn about the map.

All Mission 1 Behind Enemy Lines Workbenches in Sniper Elite Resistance

Mission 1’s Behind Enemy Lines has the Workbench Collectible to find, and even though it’s a tutorial mission, it’s still easy to miss.
